meanings.definition: To correct or adjust something by force or compulsion.
meanings.sent1: The teacher coerected the student's behavior by giving a stern warning.
meanings.sent2: She coerected the crooked picture on the wall to make it straight.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was coerected to stop chewing on the furniture.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic coerected the engine's problem with a swift repair.
meanings.sent5: The coach coerected the player's technique to improve their performance.

meanings.definition: To bring into proper order or alignment.
meanings.sent1: The librarian coerected the books on the shelf to make them neat.
meanings.sent2: He coerected the rows of chairs before the event started.
meanings.sent3: The children coerected their toys back into the toy box after playing.
meanings.sent4: The gardener coerected the plants in the garden for a symmetrical look.
meanings.sent5: The supervisor coerected the files on the desk for better organization.

meanings.definition: To rectify or amend a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: She quickly coerected the spelling mistake in her essay.
meanings.sent2: The IT specialist coerected the software bug to prevent crashes.
meanings.sent3: The chef coerected the seasoning in the dish to make it more flavorful.
meanings.sent4: The tailor coerected the hem of the dress for a perfect fit.
meanings.sent5: The accountant coerected the financial report to ensure accuracy.
